chat.title: not ER orderset
chat.message: if this is for direct LTC admission it would be from a family doctor/hospitalist, not through ER.

chat.title: Resus = MOST status
chat.message: We call this the MOST status (medical orders for scope of treatment) - there's a form that should be filled out (M0-C2). Is there a way to incorporate that into Cerner?

chat.title: Med lists - use tabs
chat.message: Andrew, this is a good example of where those "tabs" would be helpful to guide the eyes. For example, there are 3 dimenhydrinate meds (luckily those are followed closely with the dose and route). However, loperamide there are 2 lines with the same, but you have to read over to the R hand side to see which dose / route to give. I would advise getting consistency with where a doctor can quickly glance at the screen to identify the 1. Drug name. 2. Route. 3. Dose. (I personally prefer tabs, but as long as it's consistent and easy to see, I would accept it)
